snippet.title: My biggest pet peeve (it has to do with pricing)
snippet.description:
There is no price tag on your worth!  Your worth has nothing to do with what you charge your clients to help solve their problems.  It’s essential that your clients are prioritizing their own transformation. The client’s perceived value of that transformation should be in direct correlation to the impact of your work. 

You are a conduit of investment for your clients.  Read that last line again!  Your pricing and offerings are less about you and more about your clients.
In this week’s episode of Profit for Joy TV, I’m talking about this pet peeve of mine and shedding some light on why a mindset shift on this is so significant.

We’ll cover:
  - If you should publish your prices
  - What might be holding you back
  - Why communicating value is essential

Action Step: Tell us your biggest take away from this video?  Have you ever been advised to “charge what you’re worth”?  Do you feel any differently about this advice now?

Resource: Tapping Into Wealth by Margaret Lynch https://www.amazon.com/Margaret-Lynch-Tapping-Into-Wealth/dp/B00N4EVAT4/ref=sr_1_2?dchild=1&keywords=tapping+into+wealth&qid=1588346003&sr=8-2

We’d love to hear your thoughts! 
 
➣Find the blog post here: https://amberdugger.com/2020/11/my-biggest-pet-peeve/
 
➣Subscribe to the YouTube channel to get notifications when new episodes are available! https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCZUdT10iWtdqtAp_D5UzsFg
 
➣Discover the cash flow management software we recommend here: https://ynab.com/referral/?ref=i6IEKFcqrYmaE-Q-&utm_source=customer_referral
